title: Upload Tensor.h to docs upon master build
body_html:
A continual pain point of using ATen is that people don't know where to find all of the methods/functions available for their use. There is a docs/Tensor.h but it is continually out of date.

There is a very simple fix: upload the generated Tensor.h to https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/index.html along with the rest of the docs. All you need to do is modify the Makefile in docs to also pull in Tensor.h. (Because of the fact that we clean all build artifacts, you may have to do some work to find the header.)

CC @ebetica

body:
A continual pain point of using ATen is that people don't know where to find all of the methods/functions available for their use. There is a `docs/Tensor.h` but it is continually out of date.

There is a very simple fix: upload the generated `Tensor.h` to https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/index.html along with the rest of the docs. All you need to do is modify the `Makefile` in `docs` to also pull in `Tensor.h`. (Because of the fact that we clean all build artifacts, you may have to do some work to find the header.)

CC @ebetica
